div.pre: 2184 Mineo, 30 km. W of Leontini, 1905 (697) Burial: c. 289 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: c. 500 AR. Pot hoard Gela: 1 tetradr. Syracuse: 19 tetradr. (Agathocles, quadr. [7]; Nike and trophy [12]) Siculo-Punic: 28 tetradr. (Ziz [4]; Arethusa/ horse [1]; Arethusa/horse hd. [7]; Heracles/horse hd. [16]) Athens: 4 tetradr. Corinth: 1 st.; 2 fr. Disposition: Syracuse 19 (10 Sic.-Punic, 7 Syracuse, 2 Athens) Orsi, NSc 1905, pp. 438-9 Currò Pisanò AIIN 1962-4, pp. 222, 238 Jenkins, Gela, p. 155 This hd. resembles Megara Hyblaea 1966 (no. 2180 above). The remaining c. 450 coins were probably all pegasi
